title: How 3D, Sound, Digital Twins, and XR Help Protect Musical History
content: Preserving a historic musical instrument is not only about protecting its wood, metal, or varnish. For wind instruments, especially historic pipe organs and their ancient predecessors such as the Hydraulis, heritage also lives in movement, airflow, sound, and the spaces where the music is heard. These instruments are often mechanically complex and very fragile. Many cannot be played or handled frequently without risk of damage. At the same time, traditional documentation methods such as photogra...
creator: Sheena_B
sourceDescription: European Cloud for Heritage OpEn Science

title: German-speaking communities webinar is a great success
content: On 14th January 2026, we were delighted to welcome around 60 participants from Austria, Belgium, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands as well as Switzerland to our @ECHOES webinar for German-speaking communities hosted by the Austrian National Library @Österreichische Nationalbibliothek. First part of the programme – download the PDF . Some results from the ECHOES Consultation A special highlight was the panel discussion featuring three ECCCH Sister Projects with German-speaking project partner...

title: UNICHE Webinar series
content: The UNICHE Consortium, hosted by the Athena Research Centre, is holding a series of two hour webinars from the 15th-28th January. UNICHE invites creative individuals and cultural professionals to a series of online webinars showcasing the technologies that will form the UNICHE ecosystem. Across five focused sessions, technology partners will present their solutions, demonstrate real-world use cases, and engage participants in interactive co-design discussions on how these tools come together as ...
creator: Sheena_B
sourceDescription: European Cloud for Heritage OpEn Science

title: Promoting a digital environment for Europe’s cultural heritage
content: Cordis recently published a news item about ECHOES on its website entitled “Promoting a digital environment for Europe’s cultural heritage” which focuses mainly on the 2nd Cascading Grants Call, Engagement and Collaboration . ECHOES is delighted to be highlighted in this way by the Commission and are hoping to repeat of the success of the first Call which attracted just under 200 applications. Note that the deadline for Call 2 is the 30th January 2026.
creator: Sheena_B
sourceDescription: European Cloud for Heritage OpEn Science

title: MusicSphere Kick-Off Meeting: Launching a New Journey in Digital Musical Heritage
content: MusicSphere is excited to announce the launch of its project dedicated to the digital preservation, study, and immersive exploration of Europe’s musical heritage, with a special focus on pipe organs and the ancient Greek Hydraulis (water organ). The project kicked off on 16–17 October in Thessaloniki, Greece , during an inspiring meeting hosted by the Centre for Research & Technology, Hellas (CERTH) and coordinated by the Brain, Health & Virtual Reality (BHV) Group. Partners from Greece,...
creator: Sheena_B
sourceDescription: European Cloud for Heritage OpEn Science

title: Registration open for ECHOES Second Policy Event
content: The ECHOES Second Policy Event will take place in Brussels on Thursday the 5th February 2026. Registration is now open. Following ECHOES’ first Policy Event, this second occurrence will gather European, national and regional representatives, policymakers and cultural heritage experts around our theme: Towards a distributed, multi-level, collaborative governance for the Cultural Heritage Cloud . This event is the opportunity for ECHOES to reaffirm its commitment to bring together the Cultur...
creator: Sheena_B
sourceDescription: European Cloud for Heritage OpEn Science

title: Save the date! Webinar for German-speaking Communities
content: ECHOES cordially invites you to a Webinar for German-speaking Cultural Heritage Institutions which will take place on 14th January 2026 from 1 0:00-12:00 CET on Microsoft Teams, hosted by the Austrian National Library (ECHOES Consortium Member). This webinar will … offer insights into ECHOES and the European Collaborative Cloud for Cultural Heritage (ECCCH); present ongoing digital initiatives in German-speaking countries; foster networking among cultural heritage professionals from these ...

title: Save the date: Second annual event in Poznań, Poland
content: ECHOES will be holding its S econd Annual Event in Poznań, Poland from the 16th March – 20th March 2026. The meeting will bring together ECHOES partners and ECCCH sister projects along with the European Commission for progress reporting, presentation of results to date and activity planning for the future months. A public event will take place on the afternoon of Wednesday, 18th March 2026, at the Polish Optical Internet Research Center, for local stakeholders to learn more about the Cultu...

title: Towards Establishing Best Practices in Documenting Textile Imprints on Clay
content: The Textailes project will participate in the upcoming Workshop “ Towards Establishing Best Practices in Documenting Textile Imprints on Clay ”. This is being organised by the the ExplorTIC Project on Monday, December 8th, 2025 , 10:00-18:00 CEST at Warsaw University, Poland. This hybrid, hands-on workshop focuses on advancing documentation procedures and research protocols for textile imprints on clay. During the workshop, participants will work collaboratively toward formulating best practices...

sourceDescription: European Cloud for Heritage OpEn Science

title: Collaborative research scenarios focus group held in Cyprus
content: Last week, several ECHOES partners gathered at the Cyprus Institute – a partner of ECHOES – in Nicosia, Cyprus, for three days of meetings and a joint focus group on collaborative research scenarios. Meeting participants On Friday morning, ECHOES partners presented the project to an audience composed of DARIAH members, CyI researchers and the professionals invited to participate in the focus group. The focus group took place on Friday afternoon and involved Cypriot cultural heritage professional...
